title: Drawing, "Design for a Candlestick", ca. 1780
medium: Pen and brush and brown ink and wash, gray wash, yellow watercolor over graphite on cream laid paper
markings: Cooper-Union stamp on verso, lower center [Lugt 457d]
inscribed: Below drawing in brown ink: "Palmo Romano". Below inscription: ruled scale indicating dimensions
provenance: Formerly in the collection of Piancastelli
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Base of candlestick has a burning heart above a flame. The shaft is designed as a high decorative vase with knots and  garlands at base and surrounding the body, ending in a baluster with an eight pointed star.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Design for a Candlestick", ca. 1780.
ca. 1780. Pen and brush and brown ink and wash, gray wash, yellow watercolor over graphite on cream laid paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-3207.
